title: Geth is broken on ropsten chain ( 1.8.17 )

body:
RPC block dump  from parity & geth 

https://gist.github.com/veox/f274e3170e8677c7c318bc46b586be06

https://gist.github.com/eosclassicteam/4dcf3eb5726e9df8901da317da47d2cf

Made a little tool to compare Geth / Parity blocks on Ropsten: https://luit.me/eth-block-compare/

Seems like Geth isn't including transactions for some reason :confused:

Split seems to have happened in 4230605 indeed

The Parity block was on timestamp `1539451591`
The Geth block was on timestamp `1539456509` (over 1,5 hours later)

My conclusion would be that one transaction in the Parity block, wasn't acceptable in the Geth... and Parity had more mining power. 

One way to solve this would be to
- export block 4230605 from Parity into RLP
- run a memory and gas cost trace of both [Parity](https://wiki.parity.io/JSONRPC-trace-module#trace_block) and [Geth](https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/wiki/Management-APIs#debug_traceblock) on this block
- do a diff compare between output logs
- figure out which transaction caused the issue and at which opcode it forks
- identify the bug and fix the respective client
- announce which client to update and start mining

If another one occurs, rinse repeat.

@Maigre Block **4238641** also has [a conflict](https://gist.github.com/nicksavers/4c600155f4cf42b7d9905399dbc900f0). 

The thing is that if you did a fast-sync of Geth >1.8.17 _after the fork_ at block **4230605**, it would have probably skipped the check on that block and assume it's correct based on proof of work.... then break on **4238641**. Similarly, if you start fast-sync now, you'll skip fully verifying that block... etc. (explanation [here](https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/issues/17883#issuecomment-428488082))

Now the issue has been found and can be reproduced ([test case here](https://gist.github.com/holiman/c87fc7cdba83086316df7a8b1a247fa6)). 

The cause was apparently an implementation detail of [EIP-1283](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1283). Parity kept track of the refund inside each call, but defined it 'unsigned', which made it impossible to become negative (source in [Gitter chat](https://gitter.im/ethereum/AllCoreDevs?at=5bc3c1db64cfc273f9c93fcc)).

The solution discussed as of this moment is to use the interpretation of Geth. Parity has already solved the issue on their side with an update (https://github.com/paritytech/parity-ethereum/pull/9746). Miners will start mining on the Geth Constantinople chain on Ropsten to make sure it becomes the canonical chain. The Parity update should be able to follow it. If another conflict arises, it will be dealt with at that time.

Progress should be posted on [notes](https://notes.ethereum.org/s/SJE9O2ksQ), but it's a little bit behind on the latest information.

Ok thanks, yes i was fast-syncing (it's default right ?) after the 4230605 fork.

I tried to re-launch geth with the enodes specified in the notes (i took the last 2 geth enodes),
to force the use of the geth chain but nothing seems to move. Should i reset and resync from scratch with those enodes ?

```
geth console --datadir '~/ethereum/testnet' --testnet --bootnodes enode://053d2f57829e5785d10697fa6c5333e4d98cc564dbadd87805fd4fedeb09cbcb642306e3a73bd4191b27f821fb442fcf964317d6a520b29651e7dd09d1beb0ec@79.98.29.154:30303,enode://561570ba6c2f297026e14af3e6a555759430a7f8a6d556ff157e804a31908ec8e1f73cc231163fa7281227f3b46f3f0fb3ea93f61fb1a95c90350efcbccfb419@34.236.254.125:30303
```
Or i should just wait that everything settle down ?
maybe my attempts to sync during fork-times are not helping :/

EDIT:
i manually added infura / veox geth enodes using admin.addPeer()
but both end up with the same error mentionned earlier (block 4238641)
so i guess i am on a wrong chain already.. 
I will try to re-sync from the start with those nodes..
Turned out to be a Parity issue which forked the chain: https://twitter.com/lrettig/status/1051624092388986885
It seems that i am properly synced now, and mining too, after reseting the chain and fast-resync using both veox and infura geth enodes provided in notes. Thanks !

I'm not sure if it is related but my 1.8.17 ropsten nodes sync up to the proper, canonical tip, but then inexplicably fall back to syncing blocks about 2 weeks old, a log snippet:

Notice near the bottom where it jumps from block `4243856` to `4170313`. This happens about every 30 minutes once it gets synced back up to chain tip, on two separate nodes
